00034 const char *helpmsg = "Usage: joytool [OPTION]... [DEV]\n\
00035 Read values from the joystick device which DEV represents.\n\
00036 \n\
00037   -i <joyid>            set joystick id (0 - (number of joysticks-1))\n\
00038   -a <axis id>          set axis id\n\
00039   -b <button id>        set button id\n\
00040   -w                    waits for the next axis/button event\n\
00041   -c                    waits for the next complete axis/button event\n\
00042   -t <timeout>          set timeout (ms)\n\
00043   -s                    print only the values\n\
00044   -k                    keep joytool open\n\
00045   -l                    list joysticks found\n\
00046   -A                    print number of axes\n\
00047   -B                    print number of buttons\n\
00048   -N                    print name of joystick\n\
00049   -n                    print number of joysticks found\n\
00050   -h                    display this help and exit\n\
00051   -v                    output version information and exit\n\
00052 \n\
00053 If joyid was set [DEV] can be omitted.\n\
00054 Joystick ids start from 0 and reach to number of joysticks-1.\n\
00055 You can use the 'Any' id to read all buttons/axis.\n\
00056 \n\
00057 The -s (short option) prints an easily parseable output.\n\
00058  In short mode values will be printed in the following fashion:\n\
00059   type(b|a):axis/button id:value.\n\
00060 \n\
00061 Timeout counts from the last joystick axis/button change\n\
00062  (blame it on the implementation of select at least for now)\n\
00063  20 ms seems to be a reasonable minimum,else you may loose\n\
00064  consistency of joystick values returned\n\
00065 \n\
00066 The -c (complete option) will wait for an action to be completed,\n\
00067  this means that you have to pull the joystick into the middle\n\
00068  position back or release the pressed button before it will exit.\n\
00069 \n\
00070 Report bugs to <pez2001@voyagerproject.de>.\n";
